elements.short_title: It was Week 10 of 2024 at Near Future Laboratory, and some things happened.
elements.salutation:
This is the constantly evolving Near Future Laboratory Back Office Newsletter. You are one of 17,000 subscribers who appreciate the value of a futures-oriented mindset.
My thesis here is that the work we do is not a zero-sum game. We work with individuals, organizations, big brands, and educational institutions to reignite an appreciation of our existentially vital capability to Imagine possibility.
Our goal is to unlock your potential to make sense of and find value in creative practices and bring about meaningful tangible change. Call it innovation, if you like.
We seek others — individuals, institutions, brands, companies — who want to collaborate, coordinate, and amplify this goal.
Please help me by supporting this work.
You can (1) grab something from our 100% independently designed, manufactured, and published books and tools over at shop.nearfuturelaboratory.com, (2) join the NFL Discord by becoming a subscribing member at patreon.com/nearfuturelaboratory, (3) commission us to help you invest in your future and your potential, (4) amplify this by sharing with friends and colleagues.

elements.main_copy: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy black dog.

elements.title: SHOP OF FROM AN ADJACENT TIMELINE
elements.subtitle: subtitle
elements.main_copy:
Our latest artifact from a possible future in which the Sony Walkman failed..and the Sony Aibo caught on globally, and Sony dominated in the world of domesticated robots, spurring a 1980s revolution in artificial intelligence. This book tells the story of the P.K. Dick classic 'Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep', only as a counter factual in which, yeah, of course they do..all intelligent beings dream, right HAL?

But wait! Includes Flash Cards Of All Major Manufacturers Makes and Models of Honeywell & Pepperidge Farms Electronic Sheep!

Buy your set now!

elements.post_copy: The "Necessary Tomorrows" podcast, presented by Doha Debates and Al Jazeera Podcasts, blends speculative fiction with documentary elements, inviting listeners to explore potential futures shaped by the interactions between humans, artificial intelligence, and the natural world, as envisioned by science fiction writers and actualized by activists and scientists.
